programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: UFC Top 10
programme.desc: Ranking the 10 best fighters hailing from Europe. Looking back on the greatest moments from the careers of Europe's elite fighters, past and present.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: From Red Bull Ring in Austria.

programme.title: UFC Top 10
programme.desc: A look at the top 10 personalities in the UFC.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Domonique Foxworth Show
programme.desc: Domonique Foxworth shares his take on current sports events and participants.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: The Point
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship hockey show featuring highlights, news, analysis, speed, skill and access to the biggest stars, stories and personalities of the game. Hosted by John Buccigross.

programme.title: UFC Countdown
programme.desc: A look at the lives and training camps of UFC athletes as they prepare for the next UFC pay-per-view event.

programme.title: Copa Tonight
programme.desc: A preview of each action-packed day in the oldest international tournament in the world.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: England plays Slovenia in Cologne in Group C of the 2024 European Championships. The only major tournament meeting was in Gqeberha in the final round of group stage games at the 2010 World Cup. The Three Lions won 1-0 through a goal by Jermain Defoe.

programme.title: 2024 Copa America
programme.desc: Group A.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: France plays Poland in Dortmund in Group D of the 2024 European Championships. Both major tournament meetings were at the World Cup. Poland won 3-2 in Alicante in the 1982 third-place play-off and France won 3-1 in Doha in the 2022 round of last 16.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Netherlands is up against Austria in Berlin in Group D of the 2024 European Championships. Netherlands has won seven consecutive games versus Austria. The most recent of those matches was a 2-0 victory in Amsterdam in the EURO 2020 group stage.

programme.desc: Craig Carton, one of New York's best-known voices, analyzes and debates the biggest headlines in sports each morning.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Slovakia plays Romania in Frankfurt am Main in Group E of EURO 2024. Slovakia won one of its 11 matches against Romania, a 1-0 friendly win in Bratislava on Aug. 23, 1942. The most recent meeting was a 1-1 friendly draw in Bucharest on Aug. 14, 2013.

programme.title: Euro Today
programme.desc: The latest news and analyses from the UEFA European Championship.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Czechia contests Trkiye in Hamburg in Group F of the 2024 European Championships. Trkiye won both of its two EUROs matches against Czechia: 3-2 in the EURO 2008 group stage (from 2-0 down with 15 minutes left) and 2-0 in the EURO 2016 group stage.

programme.desc: Georgia is up against Portugal in Gelsenkirchen in Group F of the 2024 European Championships. The only match between these teams was a friendly in Viseu on May 31, 2008. Portugal won 2-0 courtesy of goals by Joo Moutinho and Simo (penalty).

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Ukraine takes on Belgium in Stuttgart in Group E of EURO 2024. This is the first match between these teams. Ukraine has reached the EUROs knockout phase once (quarter-finals at EURO 2020). Belgium's best EUROs performance was runners-up at EURO 1980.

programme.title: Shirley
programme.desc: Shirley is the real story of the inimitable Shirley Muldowney. Salty, sassy, unflappable - Shirley crushed stereotypes and became an integral part of the gritty, golden age of drag racing. programme.desc: Tyrese Haliburton had 35 points, which Knicks guard Donte DiVincenzo matched, but it was not enough as the Pacers got a critical 111-106 victory in Game 3 of the Eastern Conference semifinals.

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback
programme.desc: Kyrie Irving scored 22 points, including a running left-hander in the lane in the final minute to help the Mavs hold on beating Oklahoma City 105-101 to secure a 2-1 lead in the Western Conference semifinals.

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback
programme.desc: Jamal Murray swished a step-back 15-footer over Anthony Davis at the buzzer, giving the Denver Nuggets a stunning, 101-99, win over the Los Angeles Lakers and capping a comeback from a 20-point second-half deficit.

programme.desc: Evan Mobley blocked Franz Wagner's layup in the final seconds and Cleveland survived a scare from Orlando, holding off Paolo Banchero and the Magic, 104-103, in Game 5 to take a 3-2 lead in their Eastern Conference series.

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback
programme.desc: Josh Hart raised his arms and extended three fingers on each hand on his go-ahead 3-pointer with 24.4 seconds left that was finally enough to help send the New York Knicks past the 76ers, 118-115, in Game 6 and into the second round of the playoffs.
